revised_title: Geochemical Processes in Sedimentary Environments: Challenges and Insights
tldr: This article discusses the challenges and advancements in understanding sedimentary geochemical processes. It explores the role of hydrocarbon compounds, hydrogen balances, and the incorporation of sulfur into phytol. The authors also discuss the difficulty in measuring 'free' H2 and the influence of aqueous organics on redox reactions. They examine the origins of Fe and S and the timing/temperature of formation of their products, as well as the potential evidence of reduction in the Gulf Coast.
